page.title: 13POPULATION SURVEY IN ST.IVES
page.content: A "mini-survey" was carried out at St.Ives comprehensive school to try to ascertain the number of pupils who were indigenous to St.Ives. Children were asked whether their parents were similarly born in the St.Ives area. We found that only{30% of pupils questioned could say that they and their parents were indigenous to the area. Of those children who said that neither they, nor their parents were from St.Ives,{most}said they had come to live here because their parents were connected in some way with the holiday trade. It should be noted that the term 'most' is used as this was only a rough survey and it was not possible to question fully all pupils.
